text: Hi,
I create a docker-compose file to create a network with one member service and two peers.
<@U11TAFPUP|joseph> uploaded a file: <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/joseph/F1UTMQ6LQ/docker-compose.txt|docker-compose>

  ports:
    - "50051:50051"
  command: membersrvc

  command: membersrvc

text: after issuing 'docker-compose up' command, I am using a sdk/node-based client to deploy a chaincode.
the messages from sdk/node client are all successful.
Then I run with command 'docker ps -a'
the result is

c46af7ecc256        hyperledger/fabric-peer         "sh -c 'sleep 5; peer"   27 minutes ago      Up 27 minutes                                                                      prod_vp1_1
06cc49f67db6        hyperledger/fabric-peer         "sh -c 'sleep 5; peer"   27 minutes ago      Up 27 minutes       0.0.0.0:5000->5000/tcp, 0.0.0.0:30303-30304->30303-30304/tcp   prod_vp0_1
ccd681def347        hyperledger/fabric-membersrvc   "membersrvc"             27 minutes ago      Up 27 minutes       0.0.0.0:50051->50051/tcp                                       prod_membersrvc_1
2fba9fb95fb6        hyperledger/fabric-peer         "sh -c 'sleep 5; peer"   27 minutes ago      Up 27 minutes                                                                      prod_vp_1
the problem is that I don't see any chaincode docker here.
This is the log of 06cc49f67db6 docker peer.
<@U11TAFPUP|joseph> mentioned a file: <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/joseph/F1UTNF40P/peer_log.txt|peer_log.txt>.

18:37:03.940 [dockercontroller] deployImage -> ERRO 1f1 Error building images: cannot connect to Docker endpoint

vp1_1         | 19:07:25.157 [dockercontroller] Start -> ERRO 30a start-could not recreate container cannot connect to Docker endpoint

<@U0ULK2JPP>: do you have any idea about the problem?
<@U11TAFPUP>:  the CORE_VM_ENDPOINT=<http://172.17.0.1:2375> is probably incorrect

hey <@U11TAFPUP> : not sure if you are you using Docker on Mac or not (which is what I am using), but as mentioned above by <@U0ULK2JPP>  you will probably need to change your docker-compose file to something like this:
```version: '2'

services:

  membersrvc:
    image: hyperledger/fabric-membersrvc
    ports:
      - "50051:50051"
    volumes: # docker.sock is mapped as the default CORE_VM_ENDPOINT
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock
    command: membersrvc
    networks:
      - main

  vp0:
    image: hyperledger/fabric-peer
    ports:
      - "5000:5000"
      - "30303:30303"
      - "30304:30304"
    environment:
      - CORE_PEER_ADDRESSAUTODETECT=true
      - CORE_VM_ENDPOINT=unix:///var/run/docker.sock
      - CORE_LOGGING_LEVEL=DEBUG
      - CORE_PEER_ID=vp0
      - CORE_SECURITY_ENROLLID=test_vp0
      - CORE_SECURITY_ENROLLSECRET=MwYpmSRjupbT
    volumes: # docker.sock is mapped as the default CORE_VM_ENDPOINT
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock
    networks:
      - main
    command: sh -c "sleep 5; peer node start”

networks:
  main:```
note the CORE_VM_ENDPOINT, but also the volume definition, that will allow the fabric within the container to reach the host’s docker process effectively...

though you will still encounter this issue, that I also have: 
```vp0_1         | 22:22:11.091 [dockercontroller] Start -> DEBU 073 start-could not find image ...attempt to recreate image no such image
vp0_1         | 22:22:14.526 [dockercontroller] deployImage -> ERRO 074 Error building images: Tag latest not found in repository <http://docker.io/hyperledger/fabric-baseimage|docker.io/hyperledger/fabric-baseimage>
vp0_1         | 22:22:14.526 [container] unlockContainer -> DEBU 075 container lock deleted(dev-vp0-28bb2b2316171a706bb2810ec35d095f430877bf443f1061ef0f60bbe753ed440700a5312c16390d3b30199fe9465c3b75d5944358caae01ca81ef28128a1bfb)
vp0_1         | 22:22:14.526 [chaincode] Launch -> ERRO 076 launchAndWaitForRegister failed Error starting container: Tag latest not found in repository <http://docker.io/hyperledger/fabric-baseimage|docker.io/hyperledger/fabric-baseimage>```

seems to be known about…check this issue:
<https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/issues/1916>
